metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3203 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unity before 7.2.1, as used in Ubuntu 14.04, does not properly restrict access to the Dash when the lock screen is active, which allows physically proximate attackers to bypass the lock screen and execute arbitrary commands, as demonstrated by pressing the SUPER key before the screen auto-locks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunity-2d-private0 - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
libunity-core-6.0-9 - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-2d - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-2d-common - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-2d-panel - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-2d-shell - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-2d-spread - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-autopilot - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
unity-services - 7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unity package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.0+14.04.20140423-0ubuntu1').
